title: Debate: Who are the selectors in dating, men or women?
caption: false

channel_info.title: Robbie Kramer
channel_info.description:
I'm Robbie Kramer 🎙Host of The Inner Confidence Podcast & Founder of Inner Confidence, Inc.

I lived an exhilarating single life filled with adventures and lessons, and ultimately achieved what I had always aspired to – finding an amazing, feminine, and loving wife. 

I believe my experiences provide a rare balance of wild freedom and committed love, equipping me with the insights to help you navigate the complexities of dating and relationships in today's world. Let me guide you to embrace your desires, improve your social prowess, and ultimately attract the partner who aligns with your highest aspirations.

You won’t find any fluffy, new-age, or cringy stuff here, just tested, proven and actionable advice that yields results.

Apply to join our exclusive Inner Confidence Community of ambitious men who are actively working together to achieve their goals faster   ► https://innerconfidence.com/community

You can email me at robbie@innerconfidence.com with any questions or comments.

transcription: {"text": "He believes dating is broken, that it's not working as intended, that there's fault on both sides. But there is more fault on the female side than on the male side for unrealistic expectations. My thesis is that it's not broken, that there are problems that can be solved on a granular level. I think it is a market. I think the market is working closely as intended, and I don't think everyone is supposed to win in a market. I do not believe that dating is broken, period. That's been a wild overgeneralization. Wait, Dan, do you think that it's broken for the sense that someone who's in your shoes is getting the short end of the stick? It's basically like there's a mismatch and people linking up that are of similar value, I guess you could say. I think that's a tougher question to answer. I think basically online dating especially is broken. I think there's loads and loads of evidence of that. Well, let's put it like this. I think that there's a lot of fault on both sides. Most men are basically helpless, which kind of sucks, to be honest. I just think that a lot of the power to do something resides in the women's shoes. I could be wrong about this, because there's these guys that aren't doing so hot. They don't know what the fuck to do. They have no resources or whatever. Then there's the women who are the selectors. But why do you think that women are the selectors?
